body:
# wgpu-crystal

[![wgpu.cr v0.9.1](https://img.shields.io/badge/shards-v0.9.1-important)](https://shards.info/github/chances/wgpu-crystal)
[![wgpu.cr CI](https://github.com/chances/wgpu-crystal/actions/workflows/ci.yml/badge.svg)](https://github.com/chances/wgpu-crystal/actions/workflows/ci.yml)
[![wgpu.cr license: MIT](https://img.shields.io/badge/license-MIT-informational)](https://github.com/chances/wgpu-crystal/blob/master/LICENSE)

Bindings to [gfx-rs/wgpu-native](https://github.com/gfx-rs/wgpu-native) for the [Crystal](https://crystal-lang.org/) programming language.

## Installation

1. Add the dependency to your `shard.yml`:

   ```yaml
   dependencies:
     wgpu:
      github: chances/wgpu-crystal
   ```

2. Run `shards install`

## Usage

```crystal
require "wgpu"

# TODO: Write usage instructions here
```

See the [wgpu-native Usage instructions](https://github.com/gfx-rs/wgpu-native#usage).

## Development

TODO: Write development instructions here

### Running examples

#### Headless

`make example-headless`

#### Headless Triangle

`make example-triangle`

#### Windowed Triangle

TODO: Add a windowed example

Ensure [glfw3](https://formulae.brew.sh/formula/glfw) is installed.

`make example-glfw-triangle`

## Contributing

1. Fork it ([https://github.com/chances/wgpu-crystal/fork](https://github.com/chances/wgpu-crystal/fork))
2. Create your feature branch (`git checkout -b my-new-feature`)
3. Commit your changes (`git commit -am 'Add some feature'`)
4. Push to the branch (`git push origin my-new-feature`)
5. Create a new Pull Request

## Contributors

- [Chance Snow](https://github.com/chances) - creator and maintainer

def.name: set_log_callback
def.body:
@@log_callback = Box.box(callback)
LibWGPU.set_log_callback(->(level : LibWGPU::LogLevel, message : ::Pointer(UInt8)) do
  if @@log_callback.null?
    return
  end
  cb = Box(LogCallback).unbox(@@log_callback)
  cb.call(LogLevel.new(level.value), String.new(message))
end)

class_methods.name: request
class_methods.doc:
Asynchronously request a graphics Adapter.
Optionally, a `Surface` may be provided such that a compatible Adapter is selected.

See Also: [`Future::Compute`](https://github.com/crystal-community/future.cr/blob/v1.0.0/src/future.cr#L7)

def.name: request
def.body:
if @@chan.closed?
  @@chan = Channel(Adapter).new
end
callback = ->(adapter_id : LibWGPU::Adapter) do
  spawn do
    @@chan.send(self.new(adapter_id))
  end
end
callback_boxed = Box.box(callback)
@@callback_box = callback_boxed
options = LibWGPU::RequestAdapterOptions.new
if compatible_surface.nil?
else
  options.compatible_surface = compatible_surface
end
puts("Requesting graphics adapterâ€¦")
LibWGPU.instance_request_adapter(nil, pointerof(options), ->(adapter_id : LibWGPU::Adapter, data : ::Pointer(Void)) do
  cb = Box(typeof(callback)).unbox(data)
  cb.call(adapter_id)
end, callback_boxed)
return future do
  adapter = @@chan.receive
  @@chan.close
  puts("Received requested graphics adapter")
  adapter
end

def.name: properties
def.body:
if self.is_ready?
else
  raise(ADAPTER_MUST_BE_READY)
end
info = LibWGPU::AdapterProperties.new
LibWGPU.adapter_get_properties(self, pointerof(info))
return info

def.name: get_mapped_range
def.body:
if @status == BufferMapAsyncStatus::Success
else
  raise(Exception.new(message: "must have successfully mapped buffer"))
end
bytes_ptr = LibWGPU.buffer_get_mapped_range(@id, start, size)
Bytes.new(bytes_ptr.as(::Pointer(UInt8)), size, read_only: @read_only)

def.name: map_read_async
map_write_async

class_methods.name: request
class_methods.doc:
Asynchronously request a graphics Device.

See Also: [`Future::Compute`](https://github.com/crystal-community/future.cr/blob/v1.0.0/src/future.cr#L7)
class_methods.args_string: (adapter : Adapter, label : String? = nil, trace_path : String? = nil) : Future::Compute(Device)
class_methods.args_html: (adapter : Adapter, label : String? = nil, trace_path : String? = nil) : Future::Compute(Device)

def.name: request
def.body:
if adapter && adapter.is_ready?
else
  raise(ArgumentError.new(message: ADAPTER_MUST_BE_READY))
end
if @@chan.closed?
  @@chan = Channel(Device).new
end
callback = ->(device_id : LibWGPU::Device) do
  spawn do
    @@chan.send(self.new(device_id))
  end
end
callback_boxed = Box.box(callback)
@@callback_box = callback_boxed
device_extras = LibWGPU::DeviceExtras.new(LibWGPU::ChainedStruct.new(s_type: LibWGPU::NativeSType::DeviceExtras.as(LibWGPU::SType)), max_bind_groups: 4)
if label.nil?
else
  device_extras.label = label.to_unsafe
end
if trace_path.nil?
else
  device_extras.trace_path = trace_path.to_unsafe
end
device_descriptor = LibWGPU::DeviceDescriptor.new(next_in_chain: (pointerof(device_extras)).as(::Pointer(LibWGPU::ChainedStruct)))
puts("Requesting graphics deviceâ€¦")
LibWGPU.adapter_request_device(adapter, pointerof(device_descriptor), ->(device_id : LibWGPU::Device, data : ::Pointer(Void)) do
  cb = Box(typeof(callback)).unbox(data)
  cb.call(device_id)
end, callback_boxed)
return future do
  device = @@chan.receive
  @@chan.close
  puts("Received requested graphics device")
  device
end

def.name: submit
def.body:
if command_buffers.empty?
  raise(ArgumentError.new(message: "must submit one or more command buffers"))
end
if command_buffers.class.types.all? do |t|
  t == CommandBuffer
end
else
  raise(ArgumentError.new(message: "must submit only `CommandBuffer` objects"))
end
command_buffer_ids = command_buffers.map(&.id)
LibWGPU.queue_submit(@id, command_buffers.size, command_buffer_ids.to_a.to_unsafe)

constructors.name: from_spirv
constructors.args_string: (device : Device, spirv : Bytes, *args, label : String? = nil) : ShaderModule
constructors.args_html: (device : Device, spirv : Bytes, *args, label : String? = nil) : ShaderModule

def.name: from_spirv
def.body:
spirv_descriptor = LibWGPU::ShaderModuleSPIRVDescriptor.new(chain: LibWGPU::ChainedStruct.new(s_type: LibWGPU::SType::ShaderModuleSPIRVDescriptor), code_size: spirv.length, code: spirv)
descriptor = LibWGPU::ShaderModuleDescriptor.new(next_in_chain: (pointerof(spirv_descriptor)).as(::Pointer(LibWGPU::ChainedStruct)))
if label.nil?
else
  descriptor.label = label
end
device.create_shader_module(descriptor)

constructors.name: from_wgsl
constructors.args_string: (device : Device, wgsl : String, *args, label : String? = nil) : ShaderModule
constructors.args_html: (device : Device, wgsl : String, *args, label : String? = nil) : ShaderModule

def.name: from_wgsl
def.body:
wgsl_descriptor = LibWGPU::ShaderModuleWGSLDescriptor.new(chain: LibWGPU::ChainedStruct.new(s_type: LibWGPU::SType::ShaderModuleWGSLDescriptor), source: wgsl)
descriptor = LibWGPU::ShaderModuleDescriptor.new(next_in_chain: (pointerof(wgsl_descriptor)).as(::Pointer(LibWGPU::ChainedStruct)))
if label.nil?
else
  descriptor.label = label
end
device.create_shader_module(descriptor)

instance_methods.name: preferred_format
instance_methods.doc:
Asynchronously retreive the preferred `TextureFormat` for this Surface.

See Also: [`Future::Compute`](https://github.com/crystal-community/future.cr/blob/v1.0.0/src/future.cr#L7)
instance_methods.summary: Asynchronously retreive the preferred TextureFormat for this Surface.

def.name: preferred_format
def.body:
if @@chan.closed?
  @@chan = Channel(TextureFormat).new
end
callback = ->(format : TextureFormat) do
  spawn do
    @@chan.send(format)
  end
end
callback_boxed = Box.box(callback)
@@callback_box = callback_boxed
if @descriptor.label.null?
  puts("Requesting surface preferred texture formatâ€¦")
end
if @descriptor.label.null?
else
  puts("Requesting preferred texture format for #{String.new(@descriptor.label)} surfaceâ€¦")
end
LibWGPU.surface_get_preferred_format(self, adapter, ->(format : TextureFormat, data : ::Pointer(Void)) do
  cb = Box(typeof(callback)).unbox(data)
  cb.call(format)
end, callback_boxed)
@preferred_format = future do
  format = @@chan.receive
  @@chan.close
  if @descriptor.label.null?
    puts("Received requested surface texture format")
  end
  if @descriptor.label.null?
  else
    puts("Received requested texture format for #{String.new(@descriptor.label)} surface")
  end
  format
end

instance_methods.name: preferred_format
instance_methods.doc:
Lazy getter to retreive the preferred `TextureFormat` for this Surface.
Call `preferred_format(adapter : Adapter)` first.

See Also: [`Future::Compute`](https://github.com/crystal-community/future.cr/blob/v1.0.0/src/future.cr#L7)
instance_methods.summary: Lazy getter to retreive the preferred TextureFormat for this Surface.
